responses.content:
Explanation: The original statement "The quibble might be snorked and wumbled" uses the conjunction "and" to join the two predicates "snorked" and "wumbled". In propositional logic, when a conjunction (P ∧ Q) is true, then each of its components (P and Q) must also be true individually. 

Therefore, if it is true that "The quibble might be snorked and wumbled", then it logically follows that "The quibble might be snorked" and "The quibble might be wumbled" are both true independently.
